page.title: 05BOXGROVE PRIORY
page.content: In the early years of the 16th century Lord Thomas de la Ware built himself a chantry chapel to provide for the offering of masses for his soul after his death."A church within a Church." He also employed Lambert Barnard who is noted as the only English painter of his genre who is personally identifiable to paint the vaulting of the nave with the arms and crests of his own and his wife's family and her ancestors'. It is also decorated with botanical signs in Flemish Renaissance style. The Church today has several stained glass memorial windows bearing legends which sufficiently explains them. The West window was blasted by a German bomb in 1940 and all that remains is the"holy Spirit in the form of a dove" There are 420 medieval documents
